intro: Cyperus mangorensis var. volodioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf flatsedge, is a species of sedge native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments, thriving in marshy areas and shallow water. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and establish in moist soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
